duties_responsibilities.duty: Perform accounting functions and conduct the theory and practice of recording, classifying, examining, and analyzing data and records of financial transactions.
Review Country Office financial performance on a monthly basis including balance sheet reconciliations and activity reviews.
Process and record journal entries, and respond to inquiries and assist in trainings.
Maintain general ledger accounts and supporting sub-ledgers, and produce various accounting reports.
Participate in various accounting projects including external or internal audits, system upgrades, changes to accounting processes or procedures, and other projects as assigned.
Apply accounting principles and practices to a limited range of accounting and/or other fiscal functions.
Provide support for field programs by conducting live meeting training on financial systems and processes.
Review Country Office monthly financial reports and balance sheet reconciliations, and assist in various financial analysis projects and closure of accounting records.
Independently apply accounting principles and practices to a variety of accounting, budgeting, forecasting, cost accounting, and/or other fiscal functions.
Prepare reports and statements requiring interpretation and analysis, and ensure daily operations of the accounting systems.
Respond to new or changing management requests related to audit and fiscal procedures, account structures or reports, and accounting systems.
Apply in-depth knowledge of Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP), theories, and systems design.
Research, analyze, and ensure implementation of new and/or changing accounting and reporting systems.
Make risk assessment of internal financial control systems and may be requested to suggest improvements or changes in processes.
Convey concise, comprehensive, and accurate findings on matters of a complex nature in written form.

Convey issues of a complex nature in a clear, concise, and organized manner, and may consult and/or negotiate with senior management / external entities for the purpose of funding levels, cost allocations, or related financial issues.
Assist in the preparation of field office risk assessment reports.
Independently resolve issues of moderate to advanced complexity.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor's Degree or its International Equivalent - Accounting, Business Administration, Finance or Related Field.
Bi-lingual Spanish and / or French preferred.
